task_summary: Detect the T outline and the red T block, approach, then push the block with three directed strokes to fit the outline before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-type arm with a cylindrical end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a drawn T-shaped target outline on a tabletop. The robot first ensures the block is visible, localizes the target outline, and approaches above the block. It then aligns and executes a sequence of pushes (left, up, and a diagonal settling push) to seat the block inside the outline. After verifying final pose, the robot retreats and pauses. Control/observation run at 10 Hz; the policy uses short timeouts and small alignment tolerance.
stepwise_plan: Perceive block presence; scan if not visible
Move above the block and align
Check that block pose matches target
success_criteria: Block footprint overlaps the T outline with small pose error
failure_and_recovery: If the block is not seen, perform spiral scan then retry
If pushes undershoot, the retry decorator repeats the push sequence
If contact slips, alignment step runs again on the next attempt
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when the IsAt(target_T) condition passes after the push sequence, followed by a clean retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the block is currently visible before scanning.
Spiral scan to localize the block if not visible.
Moves to a pre-push height above the block.
Laterally aligns TCP with the block prior to pushing.
Executes a directed push on the block.
Verifies that the block matches the target pose.
Backs away from the object after placement.

failure_modes: Contact slip due to low friction
Robot collides with block edge causing rotation error
recovery_strategy: Retry push sequence up to 3 times
Realign before each attempt with small tolerance
Retreat and re-approach if contact fails
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue outline; instruction mentions gray block and green targetâ€”we follow frames.
Push directions (180, 90, 225 deg) approximate the observed left/up/diagonal motions.
10 Hz rate noted but not directly mapped to library ports.

expected_success_criteria: Overlap of block with outline and passing IsAt(target_T)
